subtopics: Real Numbers and Expressions: Simplifying expressions, operations with exponents and radicals, absolute values, inequalities
Linear Equations and Inequalities: Solving linear equations and inequalities in one and two variables, systems of linear equations
Functions: Introduction to functions, notation, domain and range, linear functions, graphing functions
Polynomials: Operations on polynomials, factoring polynomials, quadratic expressions and equations
Exponential and Logarithmic Functions: Introduction to exponential and logarithmic functions, properties and graphs
Points, Lines, and Angles: Properties of geometric figures, proofs, congruence, similarity
Triangles: Classifying triangles, Pythagorean Theorem, trigonometric ratios (sine, cosine, tangent)
Polygons and Circles: Properties of polygons and circles, area and perimeter calculations
Constructions: Geometric constructions using compass and straightedge
Coordinate Geometry: Introduction to coordinate plane, graphing lines and circles using equations
Functions and Relations: Advanced function topics (composite, inverse), inequalities, graphing
Polynomial and Rational Functions: Operations on polynomial and rational functions, zeros and rational expressions
Exponential and Logarithmic Functions: Advanced properties and applications of exponential and logarithmic functions
Matrices and Determinants: Introduction to matrices, operations, determinants
Sequences and Series: Arithmetic and geometric sequences, series convergence
Trigonometric Identities: Proving and using trigonometric identities
Trigonometric Functions: Graphs of trigonometric functions (sine, cosine, tangent), applications in right triangle trigonometry
Trigonometric Applications: Solving trigonometric equations, applications in complex number systems (may vary)
Limits and Continuity: Understanding limits, differentiation rules, applications of derivatives (optimization, related rates)
Integration: Introduction to indefinite and definite integrals, applications of integration (finding areas, volumes)
Data Analysis: Summarizing and interpreting data, measures of central tendency and dispersion
Probability: Calculating probabilities, conditional probability, Bayes' theorem
Statistical Distributions: Introduction to normal distribution, hypothesis testing, confidence intervals
Discrete Mathematics: Logic, set theory, graph theory
Linear Algebra: Advanced study of matrices, vector spaces, linear transformations
Calculus Applications: Applications of calculus in physics, engineering, economics
Probability and Statistics (advanced): Advanced statistical concepts, hypothesis testing, regression analysis
